Summary When people ask what I do for a living, I quite often draw a bit of a blank as to how best describe what it is I get paid for; not that there isn't quite a lot to describe, but simply that 'it'​ seems to leap and frolic around the entirety of digital solution management. So ... 
 
Visually create a nice big square and plot the following incomprehensible role acronyms at the bottom - EA, TA, BA, UX, UI, TPM, QA, CT, IxD, IA. Now along the left hand side write down: Strategy, Creative, Product ownership, Prototyping, Pitch, Interface Development, CMS Solutions, Recruitment, Mobile Apps. Next, electrify the borders of the square with a small virtual fence and then grab a small frog (preferably south american) dip him/her in a bottle of ink, and whisper "Bienvenue à l'restaurant grenouille"​ in his ear and drop him in the square. After a few minutes the square will quite accurately predict my day to day job activity areas. Repeat daily. Virtual frogs may need to be changed regularly. 
 
Alternatively, what I usually say in a social arena is "Oh, you know, tippy tappy computer stuff"​ which also does the business, but takes a lot less time and effort AND will not put you on any animal charity watch lists. 
 
Travelling on the long and windy road of my career I have become quite adept at client engagement, leading teams, building complex architectures as well as creating micro-solutions and managing digital projects end to end. 
 
I've always loved creating new concepts in my head and, to make these ideas come alive, prototyping has played a key role throughout my life. Being able to go from abstract to actual is for me a joy and probably one of my most defining skills.
